solution_line_template: First find the total time to paint the rose cups: {rose_cups_order} cups / {rose_cups_per_hour} cups/hour = <<{rose_cups_order}/{rose_cups_per_hour}={time_for_rose_cups}>>{time_for_rose_cups} hour
Then find the total time to paint the lily cups: {lily_cups_order} cups / {lily_cups_per_hour} cups/hour = <<{lily_cups_order}/{lily_cups_per_hour}={time_for_lily_cups}>>{time_for_lily_cups} hours

Then add the painting time for each type of cup to find the total painting time: {time_for_rose_cups} hour + {time_for_lily_cups} hours = <<{time_for_rose_cups}+{time_for_lily_cups}={total_painting_time}>>{total_painting_time} hours

Then divide Gina's total earnings by the number of hours she works to find her hourly wage: ${total_earnings} / {total_painting_time} hours = $<<{total_earnings}/{total_painting_time}={hourly_wage}>>{hourly_wage}/hour
